title: Bereavement Services Schema
description:
Create Comprehensive Database Schema for Bereavement Services Management

Design and implement a complete database schema to track and manage bereavement support services provided to families following a patient's passing.

Core Entities to Define:

**Bereavement Cases**
- Link to deceased patient record
- Date of death and case initiation
- Assigned counselor/coordinator
- Case status (active, completed, closed)
- Family primary contact information
- Cultural/religious considerations
- Preferred contact methods and times

**Grief Counseling Sessions**
- Session type (individual, group, family, phone, in-person, virtual)
- Date, time, and duration
- Counselor assigned
- Attendees (family members present)
- Session notes and observations
- Risk assessment indicators
- Next session scheduling

**Follow-up Visits/Contacts**
- Scheduled and completed follow-up timeline (e.g., 1 week, 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 1 year)
- Contact method (phone call, home visit, letter, email)
- Contact outcome and family well-being assessment
- Issues identified requiring additional support
- Referrals made to external resources

**Family Support Tracking**
- Family member registry (name, relationship to deceased, contact info)
- Individual grief assessment scores
- Support resources provided (literature, support groups, referrals)
- Attendance at memorial services or support groups
- Special needs or accommodations required
- Consent and privacy preferences

**Additional Considerations**
- Define relationships between tables (one-to-many, many-to-many)
- Add audit fields (created_at, updated_at, created_by, updated_by)
- Include data validation rules and constraints
- Plan for HIPAA compliance and data privacy requirements
- Consider reporting needs (utilization metrics, outcome tracking)
- Support for recurring vs. one-time services
- Integration points with existing patient/family records
